result.execSummary:
The defendant David R. Tomczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning June 6, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David R. Tomczak

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

03:10 PM Defendant David R. Tomczak in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that they did not treat this as a victim case.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.  Plea of no contest to count 1 - knowingly violate a domestic abuse order.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 - knowingly violate a domestic abuse order. Statement by Attorney Tlusty.   Court orders court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  Court orders costs to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning June 6, 2022.  Appeal rights given to defendant.    - rt
Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

01:00 PM Defendant David R. Tomczak in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00; booking.  Status hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm. - rt
